ETYMOLOGY: Middle English, from up (adv.) + stair (n.) + the adverbial genitive suffix -s, meaning 'on or toward the upper floor.'

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb: modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, indicating manner, place, time, or degree.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To or toward an upper floor or story of a building.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He ran quickly upstairs when he heard the phone ringing.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他听到电话响，就迅速跑上楼了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective: modifies a noun or pronoun.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The guests will be using the upstairs bathroom.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 客人们将使用楼上的卫生间。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: identifies a person, place, or thing.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The upper floor or floors of a building.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The renovations are complete downstairs, but we still have a lot of work to do on the upstairs.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 楼下的翻修已经完成了，但楼上部分还有很多工作要做。
